entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:41PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Koyukuk River This Week... Runoff from heavy rain in the Brooks Range late last week is moving down the Koyukuk River. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 4:58PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Isolated rain showers and scattered weak thunderstorms are expected this afternoon and early evening. Wind gusts in excess of 50mph are possible in the rain showers and weak thunderstorms at times through approximately 8pm. Severe thunderstorms are not expected this afternoon and evening.

entry.summary: .Moderate to heavy rain is likely to fall across portions of central and north-central WY from Thursday afternoon through Friday afternoon. Amounts over one inch are expected. This addition rainfall with combine with already saturated soils and continued snowmelt runoff to create additional flooding situations across the area.
